segment.source: Removing MBAM Server Features or Software
segment.target: Removing MBAM Server Features or Software

segment.source: Removing MBAM Server Features or Software
segment.target: Removing MBAM Server Features or Software

segment.source: Removing MBAM Server Features or Software
segment.target: Removing MBAM Server Features or Software

segment.source: These instructions explain how to remove software and features from Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM).
segment.target: These instructions explain how to remove software and features from Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM).

segment.source: If you remove MBAM Server features, only the configured features are removed from the server, not the MBAM Server software.
segment.target: If you remove MBAM Server features, only the configured features are removed from the server, not the MBAM Server software.

segment.source: If you remove the MBAM Server software, the software and any MBAM Server features that you configured on that server are removed.
segment.target: If you remove the MBAM Server software, the software and any MBAM Server features that you configured on that server are removed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To prevent the accidental removal of data, MBAM provides no mechanism for removing the databases; you must do that manually.
segment.target: To prevent the accidental removal of data, MBAM provides no mechanism for removing the databases; you must do that manually.

segment.source: Removing MBAM Server features
segment.target: Removing MBAM Server features

segment.source: You can use either of the following methods to remove MBAM Server features that you have configured:
segment.target: You can use either of the following methods to remove MBAM Server features that you have configured:

segment.source: MBAM Server Configuration wizard
segment.target: MBAM Server Configuration wizard

segment.source: Windows PowerShell cmdlets
segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlets

segment.source: Using the MBAM Server Configuration wizard to remove features
segment.target: Using the MBAM Server Configuration wizard to remove features

segment.source: Follow these instructions to use the MBAM Server Configuration wizard to remove configured MBAM Server features from a server.
segment.target: Follow these instructions to use the MBAM Server Configuration wizard to remove configured MBAM Server features from a server.

segment.source: To remove MBAM features by using the wizard
segment.target: To remove MBAM features by using the wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to remove features, select MBAM Server Configuration to open the configuration wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to remove features, select MBAM Server Configuration to open the configuration wizard.

segment.source: Click Remove Features, select the features to remove, and then click Next.
segment.target: Click Remove Features, select the features to remove, and then click Next.

segment.source: A Summary page displays the features you selected for removal.
segment.target: A Summary page displays the features you selected for removal.

segment.source: Click Remove to start removing the features, and then click Close.
segment.target: Click Remove to start removing the features, and then click Close.

segment.source: Using Windows PowerShell to remove features
segment.target: Using Windows PowerShell to remove features

segment.source: Use the following steps as a general guide to remove MBAM Server features by using Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: Use the following steps as a general guide to remove MBAM Server features by using Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: To remove MBAM features by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To remove MBAM features by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Before removing any features, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Before removing any features, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Use the following cmdlets to remove MBAM Server features:
segment.target: Use the following cmdlets to remove MBAM Server features:

segment.source: Disable-MbamReport
segment.target: Disable-MbamReport

segment.source: Disable-MbamWebApplication
segment.target: Disable-MbamWebApplication

segment.source: Disable-MbamCMIntegration
segment.target: Disable-MbamCMIntegration

segment.source: To get help with Windows PowerShell cmdlets, type Get-Helpcmdlet or see the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Automation with Windows PowerShell page for the MBAM Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: To get help with Windows PowerShell cmdlets, type Get-Helpcmdlet or see the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Automation with Windows PowerShell page for the MBAM Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: Removing MBAM Server software
segment.target: Removing MBAM Server software

segment.source: Use the following steps to remove the MBAM Server software and any MBAM Server features that you configured on that server.
segment.target: Use the following steps to remove the MBAM Server software and any MBAM Server features that you configured on that server.

segment.source: To remove the MBAM Server software
segment.target: To remove the MBAM Server software

segment.source: On the server where you want to uninstall the MBAM Server software, run MBAMserversetup.exe to start the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to uninstall the MBAM Server software, run MBAMserversetup.exe to start the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: Select Uninstall, and follow the remaining prompts to complete the process of uninstalling the MBAM Server software.
segment.target: Select Uninstall, and follow the remaining prompts to complete the process of uninstalling the MBAM Server software.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
